headline: Chocolate Zucchini Bread II
description: Chocolate Zucchini bread with a cinnamon twist.
name: Chocolate Zucchini Bread II

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease two 9x5 inch loaf pans.

In large bowl, combine flour, cocoa, cinnamon, baking soda, baking powder and salt, mix well. In separate bowl, combine sugar and eggs, beat until well blended. Add oil and vanilla; beat until combined. Stir in zucchini. Add flour mixture; stir just until moistened. Stir in nuts and chocolate chips. Spoon evenly into loaf pans.
Bake in preheated oven for 55 to 60 minutes, or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool in pans for 10 minutes. Remove bread from pans; cool completely on wire rack.

review.reviewBody: I made no changes. It's currently in the oven.
Perfection! Eliminated the nuts and convection baked for 50 minutes. Will def make again! Family loved!!!!!
My family loved it!

I made a few changes, writing this to remind myself. Half wheat flour, half all purpose/white (2.5 c total). Half cup of cocoa. Applesauce instead of oil, little under 2c of sugar, no nuts. Baked in a Bundt, about 55 min at 350. Delicious and moist!
Perfect recipe
Freaking easy and awesome!!!

This is yummy, but for my own personal tastes, there is too much cinnamon in it. 

I did use half of regular Dutch cocoa (Hershey's Special Dark), and the other half was jet black cocoa. To be able to use the jet black cocoa as half of the cocoa, I had to modify the amounts of baking soda and baking powder so that they were also at a 1:1 ratio. 

I kept back the chocolate chips until the batter was in the loaf pans so that I could make sure each loaf got the same amount of chocolate chips. Also, I weighed the batter in each loaf pan to be sure each loaf got the same amount of batter. I then added the chips on top and stirred them in gently with a chop stick. They didn't sink down.

Personally, I would have liked a higher rise to the loaf, but it's really good. I'm wondering if a bit of buttermilk would work.....
This is really good. Add some minced ginger and a half tsp (or more!) of cayenne and you got yourself a Diablo loaf!
My family loves this bread especially my daughter who will ask me to make this for her with some miniature chocolate chips. Yummy!!!
delicious!! will definitely make again.

I made this and replaced flour with almond flour and the sugar with Truvia sweetener as well as no sugar chocolate chips. Made them into muffins instead! Great way to make Keto friendly muffins. They turned out really good and very moist! I stored them in the freezer and ate them for breakfast, warming them in the microwave. So good! Loved it!
I did make a few changes. Used 1cup brown sugar with 1 cup white. Also I substituted 1/2 cup unsweetened apple sauce with 1/2 cup oil. The bread came out very moist !
I substituted Stevia for sugar

Next time I will try an altitude adjustment, baked at 6,200 feet and muffins had flat tops that ran together, but that did not affect taste/texture. Moist and DELICIOUS! 
Had 1 C leftover shredded zucchini so I halved this recipe (used 1 whole egg + 1 egg white; 1/8 heaping C cocoa) and it worked perfectly for 12 muffins. (baked 22 min.) Out of vanilla extract, substituted equal amount brewed coffee. Out of walnuts, not missed at all. Mixed chocolate chips with dry ingredients so they didn’t sink. Muffins released from pan easily. Keeper!!!
Rich, moist, and tasty! I omitted the nuts because I’ve got picky eaters, but it’s delicious regardless. Followed the exact recipe and it turned out great.
So chocolatey and delicious. Made as written except used self-rising flour instead of all purpose flour, salt, baking soda & powder. Will definitely make this again. Very moist!

This is delicious! My friend gave me home grown zucchini so I searched zucchini recipes. You can't even tell zucchini is in it and it's healthy! I cut back on the choc chips, only added about 1/3 cup, I don't think it needs that many. And I don't use nuts. Very good for breakfast!
Easy and delicious
Yum! Moist and chocolatey
Turned out perfect. I followed the recipe exactly. Very yummy and moist.
A little dry but my family liked it. A great way to use zucchini. This recipe makes two nice size loaves a bread which is nice to freeze for a future get together.
It’s great... made it with a mix of white and dark chocolate chips.
Excellent recipe - made it exactly as written (did grease and flour my pans though) and it turned out great!
Pretty darn delicious. I did do half applesauce and half oil. Used exact amount of zucchini and made into muffins. Looks and tastes great not sticky wet on top.

Good flavour. I made mine into muffins and left them in too long (30 mins) so they were a touch dry. I reduced the sugar and used 1 cup cane sugar and 1/2 cup coconut palm sugar. I also decreased the flour by 1/2 cup and increased the cocoa (I think another review suggested that). They won't last long.

Was my first time making zucchini bread. Followed the recipe and ended up with two moist, chocolatey loafs. Had to bake it for a bit longer to get to the done state, but that was the only issue. Great recipe!
Delish! Moist and chocolatey!
Delicious. I made muffins instead of a loaf. With the mix I was able to make 16 large muffins. I also added a full bag of semi chocolate chips.
It's really moist. I substituted a gluten free flour mix 1:1 and it turned out great! I just wish it was more choclate-y :)

I altered the recipe by using a gluten free flour mixture. I then forgot to add the zucchini until the very end. (I had to put the batter back into the mixer with the chocolate chips already added!) With those charges, this still turned out to be great bread. My gluten free friends loved the bread as well. I’ll be making it again soon by following the recipe exactly using traditional flour for me and my non GF friends.
I recently made this with frozen zucchini that I thawed and it was really dry I don’t know why though because I made in the summer and it was great.

Oh my word this recipe was delicious! I made the recipe as written and was a bit skeptical but it had great review so I gave it a go. I had a bunch of zucchini to use up, so why not. I did make muffins instead of loves just because they would be easier for the kids to grab and eat. The cook time was about half of what was stated. The muffins were moist and chocolaty and my whole family loved them. The only think I would change id maybe doubling the chocolate chips. I froze half the batch for later the recipe made 28 muffins.

It tastes just amazing, but definitely needed more time in the oven compared to the recipe. I had to add an extra 18-20min bake time which after that the toothpick finally came out clean. But once I cooled & sliced the bread it actually turned out to be a little mushy still in the middle. A texture I would say looked similar to if I had mixed bread with pudding. Just not enough pudding that it’s soggy looking. I’m gonna to play around with the bake time some more. I want to figure out how much more time it still needs to cook after the additional 20min that I already added to the recipes max bake time. Also I might try using foil at some point in the baking time that way I can keep adding to the total time it’s in the oven while also trying to keep the top from becoming brittle & over cooked. Besides that

I chose this recipe because it’s nearly identical to the recipe I used to make regular zucchini bread, And I love that recipe. The chocolate bread however, when it comes out of the oven, there’s very little flavor. It almost makes you disappointed that you made it. My advice to you is to make it in the evening and let it rest until the next day. It needs time to rest to come to full flavor, and then, once you cut into it, it’s not going last more than a few hours. its amazing! I alter the recipe as I do with all recipes that require some type of cooking oil, I always use olive oil. And my oven cooks it in only 50 minutes. Be sure to check it early for doneness.
I like this bread a lot. The longer you wait to eat it, the better tasting it gets. Unfortunately or fortunately, it is so smells so good that we end up eating it right off the oven.
Was amazing. Kis asked for more “cake”
Pretty good, but a little dry.
Followed recipe exactly. Baked about 5 min too long for my oven; could be a little moister. Tastes great.
it was ok. was not as moist as i thought it would be. had to add a little water because the batter still had powder. think next time more seasoning and ill probably add milk

I was worried how it would turn out at 5,000 feet but I turned out great. Easy to make and flavorful. I love the combination of cinnamon and chocolate chips. I used mini chocolate chips and more like 1 1/2 cups of them. I didn’t have any regular size loaf pans so used my mini loaf pan that makes 4 loafs. Baked for 50 minutes. I’ll be making this again soon.
This is a very special treat. My favorite bread recipe to keep in reserve for company. Great as a coffee cake or dessert.
Probably the best recipe I have ever made. Did not last long. My kids can’t get enough. Super easy and I made just as recipe said.
YUMMY
Made it as written except for substituting applesauce for oil & 1c. whole wheat flour with 2c of white flour. Baked for 1 hr. Amazing!! Love it every time. It freezes great too1
Turned out great!! I cut the sugar in half, used Apple sauce for oil and used half wheat flour. I will be using this recipe again soon!!

I did make a few of the alterations suggested by others to make it more healthy - doing half applesauce/half oil, replacing 1 cup of flour with whole wheat. It mixed together well, had the expected taste and consistency, and baked up beautifully - I pulled the loaves out after 50 minutes because they were done. It was fluffy, moist, and delicious, a big hit with my whole family! I have no doubt that the original recipe would turn out just as well, as these are standard substitutions. A few notes based on my experience of doing this and other similar breads. First, make sure to press down/pack the shredded zucchini to get the full measure...a little extra even will be okay. Second, make sure that the pans are well greased...if you miss a spot, there's a chance the bread will stick. Finally, do not overcook! Set your timer lower than what you would expect. If you think it might be done (the material inside the cracks appears dry, it is starting to pull away from the sides, it smells done), check it and pull it. If you overcook, it will likely end up dried out as well as having that "toasted chocolate" taste.
Very moist with lots of flavor.

These were very good. We did change the recipe solely to make a little more healthy. Used 2 c. AP flour and 1 c. whole wheat flour, subbed applesauce for the oil, cut the sugar down to 1 1/2 cups and the chocolate chips down to 1/2 c of mini chips. My son really liked them.

I love this recipe it is easy and VERY yummy! :) It is a good way to use up the constant supply of zucchini in the garden! Instead of mixing the chocolate chips in I just sprinkled them on the top. I also used dark 60% chocolate chips (my favorite!). If you love chocolate I am sure you will enjoy this recipe as well!

I made this today and changed it up a little . I am a celiac and wanted to make it Gluten Free. I substituted the flour for GF flour and added a teaspoon of xanthum gum. It was moist and absolutely delicious. We have so many zucchinis in our garden, and I will definitely make it again!!
Perfect! I added a little more zucchini, just because I had it and didn't want to throw it away. It made 3 loaves. I definitely will use this recipe again!
Really flavourful, but a bit dry.

I made it with dark cocoa powder ( added about a tablespoon extra) and I puréed the zucchini! I made them in muffins ( no paper cups, I just sprayed the muffin pans) so they baked about 18 to 20 minutes. I got praise from all who tasted. This goes in the faves and will be made over and over again.
Yield 24 regular size muffins

I have used this recipe a couple of times now. One loaf is always sent to work with the hubby and it rarely lasts beyond 9am. I usually sub applesauce for the oil and find it makes for a nice and moist bread. This time I added a touch of nutmeg and added a streusel like toppping and the result was a yummy treat to add to the holiday cookie tray!
I make this for Christmas and it's always a hit. I make 6 mini loaves in small disposable foil pans, and bake for about 43 minutes. They freeze great too.

I used gluten free flour mix instead of regular flour, and then added about 1/2 tsp more baking soda and baking powder, and it turned out awesome! Moist and thick almost like a brownie, but with zucchini!
Used half whole wheat & half white flour. May add some sour cream next time to make it moister. Very good as is tho.
very good! Took 1/2 loaf to share with some coworkers and they loved it! I didn't change anything except I omitted the walnuts in case someone was allergic.
This turned out great. 2nd time I changed bs to 3/4t & up the cp.

The chocolate chips didn't sink. It was very tasty. I only had about 1/2 cup of walnuts so that's all I used. Otherwise I did not alter the recipe. It took about 1hr and 5 min to cook through. You could try this with pecans instead of walnuts.

I liked this recipe a lot. I am 13 years old and being a kid, I love sweet chocolate stuff. My siblings loved it, but my parents thought it a little to much on the chocolate side for Zucchini bread. If you have a big group of kids then this is a great fall recipe!!!
Good way to use up zucchini plus it's chocolate! Followed one suggestion and increased the cocoa to 1/2 cup, then baked it in 24 cupcakes for 25 minutes per tray. Very chocolate and moist!

I used 1 cup sugar and 1/2 cup Splenda. also 1/2 cup oil and 1 cup unsweetened applesauce. It turned out awesome. My grandkids had the first loaf gone in no time. They thought that I had made brownies. I let some choc chips melt on top of the second loaf. This is a recipe I will make again for sure. I omitted the nuts as grandkids don't like them. I didn't miss them at all.
Perfect! Added to more tablespoons of flour for High Altitude baking and baked for an additional 15 minutes. Delicious!
My family loved it!

Made as written. Had high hopes for this bread...it was tasty but dry. I'm going to try the recipe one more time this season but I'll decrease the amount of flour next time and see if that increases the moistness of the loaf.

This was simple to throw together, and worth the effort. It's not a dark rich chocolate, but mild chocolate that goes well with the cinnamon . For some reason the only nuts in the house were hazelnuts, and they gave it a slight Nutella like flavor, I highly recommend trying that substitution!

I made this recipe 3 times and changed it slightly each time to make it healthier. I'm glad I did because I ate almost all of it myself. (I made 4 mini loaves each time)

These are the substitutions I liked best:

All wheat flour (combinations of wheat, barley, almond etc)
1 c applesauce and 1/4 c canola oil
3 tsp vanilla
an extra 2-4 Tbs of cocoa 
1/2 c sugar
Would omit the cinnamon next time. Not a huge fan.
Turned out amazing and tasteful!!!! I separated mine into 3 loaves and it took about 45 minutes.

It was ok. I followed the most helpful review and did 2 cups whole wheat and used applesauce in lieu of oil (home canned applesauce so probably not the health benefit she had in mind bc we sweeten it.) I also omitted the nuts and chocolate chips bc I like neither in my breads. It will get eaten, but it isn't very chocolatey in my mind. Maybe that would be more noticeable without the heavier whole wheat flour?
We will make it again, with a little less cinnamon. Delicious!

THIS is an extraordinary recipe!! you want a easy delicious treat..try this! My youngest son and I made chocolate zucchini bread and muffins tonight.. soo moist and delicious! I did add cloves as well and it kicked the flavor a notch.. we will use the recipe again. :-)
I made no changes and have made it again and again to be devoured by my grandchildren!!
Substituted apple sauce for oil and added a bit of nutmeg to enhance the spice. Omitted the nuts. Turned out perfectly moist and delicious!
Left out the nuts but otherwise made as directed. Will definitely make again.
Very moist and chocolaty. Its not too sweet and its not too dull which is a great plus. And it stays moist for a couple days.
Best recipe ever! I even substitute in my gluten free flour so my kids can eat this. I make the mini muffins out of this batter and freeze them in snack bags. Great on the go snack!

We made 10 loaves (not even kidding) of this recipe this past weekend. It's similar to the standard recipe we make from this site with the addition of the cocoa powder. The kids inhaled it! We will make this again and again.

Great recipe. I made mini loafs and muffins with this recipe. I only changed the baking time, to 20-22mins because of the smaller loaf pans. Everything else I followed as written. Moist, not to sweet, chocolatey, and delicious. My kids loved them too!
Made this as is and everyone love it. !

I made this recipe exactly as described and I love, love, love it!!! My whole family (even the finicky ones) gobbled them up. I made muffins instead of bread and the batch yielded 24 muffins. Today when I got home from work, there were TWO muffins left out of the 24. Needless to say, this recipe is a huge hit. Thank you very much!
I substituted applesauce in place of oil and added 3Tbsp of sour cream and Everyone loved it . Great use of zucchini,

Major change required for it to move from dry(2) to wonderful(5). So I gave it a 4 with modifications.
 
Instead of 2 cups of grated zucchini, I used 4 based on other recipes for "moist chocolate zucchini bread" that I found on the web. It made all the difference. For those of you that are coming up with dry loaves, give this mod a try. Kids went from "blah" to "wow!"
Mine turned out drier than I prefer also so next time I will try scaling back on the flour. Otherwise the flavor profile was nice.

My only change was to stir in raisins instead if chocolate chips. The flavor is quite nice, but I would have preferred a more moist texture. I baked mine 52 minutes at a slightly lower temperature. It is hard to cut cleanly with no crumbles. But the important thing is it does taste good. Thank you, Shanna

It's a really good recipe! We love the chocolate cinnamon flavor. Tastes awesome without nuts! One time I didn't have chocolate chips, didn't make much difference as the cocoa powder made it plenty chocolate-y.

This recipe was good. It wasn't what I was expecting as far as I wanted something that was more moist and cake like. The batter on mine was very thick and I made muffins which only took 25 minutes to bake. I am thinking I will try something to make it a bit more moist like like yogurt or less flour. But with that said, they still had a very good flavor just a thicker consistency. The kids liked them and couldn't even tell there was zucchini in it.

I absolutely love this recipe. It's my go to for zucchini bread now. This last time I added a simple cream cheese filling and I think it is a great addition to the recipe. Mix 1 egg, 4oz softened cream cheese, 1/4 cup sugar and 3 tablespoons flour. Pour half the batter in and spread layer of cream cheese filling in. Pour rest of batter over the top. Add about an extra 10 minutes baking time. It's awesome!
just made this for fun and it was great!! my siblings are trying to steal the loafs because their so good!! im definitely making this again!! :D

This recipe is perfect!! Make sure to follow the directions exactly and don't over bake. I baked mine for 50 min. Next time I will try mini chocolate chips in this, as the regular ones tend to fall out because of how moist the bread is. This recipe is a must try for all the zucchini and cinnamon lovers.

Excellent! And relatively healthy. I substituted 1 cup of brown sugar for 1 of the cups of white sugar. I really packed my two-cup measuring cup with the grated zucchini (took exactly two of them), so mine came out nice and moist.
This was really good! Not dry at all. I used applesauce instead of oil and skipped the chocolate chips and nuts. Otherwise, I made as written

I substituted applesauce for some of the oil. I did not have any chocolate chips, but I did have some Mexican hot chocolate disks. So I ground those up and added it in addition to the cocoa power. The bread ended up being pretty good.
It was amazing but I will say I did add more chocolate and sugar

Loved it...made it once, making it again!!!
Exactly the way it says, haven't tried it with any modifications, loved it the way it is :)

I have made this recipe several times now, as written and varying it up for healthier versions, and it has come out delicious and moist every time. After greasing the pan, I sprinkle cinnamon and sugar on the bottom before I put the dough in, and it creates a crispy crust.
Delicious! I substituted unsweetened applesauce for the all of the oil and used Epicure Selections cocoa and chocolate; it was amazing!! Try it slathered with peanut butter (my hubby is a genius!!)!
Making this again this year. Its my Favorite.
